choices: Wait, it was just a dream...
1.content:
It seemed like a normal day out. It was fairly sunny, but a strong breeze kept you cool as you walked home from a long day at school. You enter your neighborhood and begin to cut through people yards in order shorten the walk. As you walk through the green grass, you feel the breeze pick up. You look behind you to see a large storm system coming towards you.

You begin to pick up the pace, not wanting to get soaked. You feel gusts of wind as well as small rain drops pelting your back. You start to jog through the yards as you hear a crack of thunder. The drizzling is getting worse as the clouds roll in above. Everything has gotten slightly darken, aside from the bolts of lightning shooting off above. You start sprinting to you house. A few feet from your driveway, and flash of light shoots out right in front of you. You fall to the ground as a blue static cloud envelopes your body. You instantly feel sleepy, and black out.

An unknown period of time later, you wake up... The first thing you realize is that your stark naked. You try to search next to you for your cloths but find nothing. Thats when you look around to see, something has changed, drastically. The world around you is massive.

You begin to get dizzy by shear size of house you can see in the distance, but it is not your own house. Standing there, dumbfounded, you look around more. You realize that your are still on some concrete. You look to your right and see some grass. "No this can't be!" to scream. Where ever you are, you have shrunk.... to about
1.title: It was a normal day....

11.content: Opening your eyes slightly, you shiver a little bit. You rub your arms to warm your self up "What the hell, where are my cloths.." Your mind jumps into gear and you look around and say to yourself "where am I?". You realize your in a small carpeted room with white walls,and a door. You struggle to stand up, muscles failing you a bit you hobble over to the door and try to turn the knob. It was locked. "what the hell is going on here.. and why the heck am I so sore" you think to your self as you begin to bang on the door. After a few loud knocks, you feel a little light headed... everything dims a little, and you collapse on the floor. Trying to keep your eyes open as you lose consciousness, you see the door slowly open. Right before you are completely asleep, you definitely saw an anthro....
11.title: Wait, it was just a dream...

111.content:
You wake up, but you don't open your eyes. A slight shiver takes over your body. You start to stretch out, and feel an artificial breeze of air-conditioning flow over you.

It all floods back to you.

You jump up out of your daze and frantically look around. You were still in that room, and still stark naked. The only difference now was there was some sort of collar on you. You decide not to fidget with it, because you have more important things at hand. Like how to get out of this room. You pull your self up, not nearly as tired as you were earlier. You study the room your in more closely this time, noticing a tiny white camera in the corner of the room that you must have missed before.

You take a few steps towards it and look into at it, focusing on the lens of the camera. Before you took another step forward, you remembered the collar. Running your fingers along its metallic surface, you were amazed by how decorated it was. You could feel little bumps and notches... You walk over to the stainless steel door knob and try to see the reflection. "What is this thing?" you think to yourself. Looking at the warped reflection, you see the collar covered in things that looked electronic. "Is this some kind of shock collar?" you again contemplate. Before you could answer your own question, the door knob jiggles a bit. You almost fall over from the change in sound.

You scoot back a little bit. You watch as the door slowly swings open. On the other side was anthromorphic animal. This one was different then the one earlier. It was some kind of....
111.title: You wake up later.

1111.content: Your in completely stupefied at what your seeing. It looked to be a cross between a human and
1111.title: Canine

11112.content: It was a mix between a human, and a black and brown German Shepard. Everything below the neck, besides the fur and tail, were that of a human body, but the head was shaped like a canine's. It looked at your fear filled form and cracked a smile. You then notice the gender of the creature.
11112.title: Some Kind of Domestic Dog

choices: There are others in the elevator.
111121.content:
The creature looked about a head taller then you, it was wearing a pair of cargo shorts and no shirt, and the lack of breast made you think male.

"Come Here" The creature said in a commanding voice. Which also confirmed your thoughts on the gender.

You didn't move a muscle. You were paralyzed with fear... You just sat there, breathing heavy, heart thumping out of control.

The creature lifts his hand, revealing what look like a key fob. He clicked a button. Nothing happened for a few silent, intense seconds, but then a beep came from nowhere. Wait... it was coming from the collar.

The creature crossed his arms.

"Let's try that one more time, come here."

Though some of your initial fear had subsided, you didn't want to go near that thing. But instead, you started to inch toward him... "what the hell?" your inner voice screamed. The creature watch you as you tried to resist the invisible force that was causing you to walk toward him. You then realized it was the collar.

You frantically start to claw at it, and pry it off, all while you legs slowly step toward the anthro-dog. You finally blurt out "Get this thing off of me!".

The creature just smirked. "Put your hands down" he said.

Almost instantly your hand dropped to your sides. You try to move, but nothing budged, you frantically strain your neck, as if the rise in blood pressure would break the electronic collar off. Nothings seems to work. Again, you feel exhausted from your efforts. You stopped fighting the force... for now.

You were now shoulder to chest with the furry creature when you finally stopped.

"Follow me" the create stated.

And as if a servant to a master, you body did.

The creature walked through a long white walled hallways, all covered with doors, such as the one you had just come out of. At the end of the hall, you see what looks to be an elevator. Once you had both reached the door, the anthro speaks again.

"Press the button"

Still a little exhausted from you struggles earlier, you body reaches forward and presses it. You glance up at the creature to see him smirk, almost as if he just won a challenge, the look of satisfaction surrounded by resentment.

The doors opened.
111121.title: It was male

1111211.content:
You watch the doors steel colored doors part in the middle. Inside was a creature similar to the canine, it had what looked like a human body, but it had the head of a Jaguar. It's black fur contrasted against the white lab coat it was wearing, and really made it stand out. This creature looked female, however, because it had to bulges at the top of the lab coat, indicating breast. She was looking at a clip board when the door opened, and didn't even pause to look up when the doors opened.

The black and brown German Shepard walked in, you defeated body soon followed.

The inside of the elevator was mirrored. You could now clearly see that the metal color was lit up by some small green LED's. You look at the reflection and stare at you naked form. Your body looked so much more week then the two stand next to you. Still naked, you blush a bit at how foolish you felt. But that was the least of you worries.

You took a small deep breathe and were to speak, when the Jaguar looked up from her clipboard. She glance at the Canine, which she gave a polite smile too, and then to you, which she examined as if you were made of wood.

She speaks "uh, what a strange little creature. What planet did this one come from?"

The Shepard responded sincerely with "A new planet called earth, they just got the coordinates for it, this is one of the first commercial ones they've brought over."

She responded with genuine interest "oh wow, I didn't think we would start sale on those for a few months... gosh, everything advances so quick now adays..."

The canine spoke once more. "Yeah, tell me about. Even though these new things are extremely expensive, these life forms are quite similar to ours, at least in shape and mind."

They both giggled a little bit at that last part.

*Ding*

“Well this looks like this is my floor”, the Anthro-Jaguar says while stepping forward. "It was nice talking to you, have fun with your new toy"

"Oh I will" The Shepard says while he glances back down at your now confused form.

You mind is completely boggled with what you just heard. You start to think to yourself "What is going on... what did she mean by 'toy'. What the hell is this place..."

*Ding*

The doors open once more. The Shepard walks out but, accidentally hitting you with his tail, though thinking nothing of it. You follow, but not at you own will. This floor looked like that of a hospital lobby, minus the sick people. In the center was a station of people in lab coats bustling in and grabbing things and leaving. The Shepard glanced at a women who had the body of a wolf, quite similar to the Shepard body actually, and says “have a good one”.

”You too sir.” She responded

This whole time, still stark naked, your astounded by all the different creatures around you. You see about twenty different anthro animals.

You look straight ahead, to see to electronic doors, with a security guard next to it. As you approach, the red Anthro Fox security guard gives a quick word to the Shepard.

“make sure you have that collar on, because we don’t offer refunds for runaways."


“Sure thing” He says with a smile.

And with that, the guard pressed a button, and the door opened.
1111211.title: There are others in the elevator.

11112111.content:
The light shine down on what seems like a hot day. The coolness of the A/C fades as you walk away. You glance back at the building you came out out, straining to turn and see. You catch a glimpse of a sign reading "Planetary Transfer Facility"

You look around, at a world you now know is not Earth, and notice, it looks just like Earth. You finally calm down enough to speak.

"Where am I?"

The Shepard looks looks at you, a little surprised you even talked.

The creature sighed a little bit, gathering it's thoughts...

"Where to start..." He began.

First off, this is a planet called Dradua (Dra-do-a). I don't plan on giving you an astronomy lesson, so I will leave it at that. It has similar atmospheric conditions that your planet has, so you will survive just fine, and PTI provides a month worth of food for you as you make the switch. You were brought here by Planetary Transfer Incorporated. That collar around your neck, basically controls your body. It is registered to do whatever is asked on command. There is no point in trying to resist it, the company guarantees that it will control you. And it's impossible for you to take it off.

Your species is the new to being beamed over. They have found a few other planets that support life, but earth is a gold-mine compared to them. Trillions of intelligent beings on them. You, were one of the first to be brought over commercially, for public sale, but man, you are worth every penny . The ones have come before you have been brought to labs to test you for any diseases you may carry and the ability to survive under certain conditions. Now for the reason why your here."
11112111.title: In A Furry World.....

choices: You reach what looks like a car
111121112.content:
"Your basically a slave to others on this planet. We have no war, we have no god, no diseases or famines we only have peace and time. So we entertain our selves the best we can. With the power of technology, the future is you. Don't take my sincereness to heart, I am only going to explain this to you once, and this is it. You will do whatever it is asked of you, or you will be forced to do it. Either way, it will get done. Your life rest in our hands, we could ask you to kill yourself, and you would do it, but for now, that would just be a waste of money for short term enjoyment." He gave a sarcastic smile at the last part....

You just felt like you died a little inside... As if your heart just dropped to the ground below and some one had walked over it. You were on the verge of sobbing.

"Wh...why would you do this to me?" you barely made out between gasping sobs.

"It's nothing personal, it's just luck of the draw" He smiled again at the last part.

You sadness quickly turned to rage as you tried to lash out at him, but your body just respond by standing there, hands at your sides.

The Anthro started walking again, you followed... "you'll get used to it... eventually..."
111121112.title: Your used for other reasons.

1111211121.content:
The whole time your body followed the anthro dog, you looked around. You new you were in some kind of city, everything looked the same as any city would, but different. All the signs were in a strange language, nothing comparable to what you had back on Earth. And the buildings had a more futuristic shape to it.

All while walking, an assortment of different creatures walked by you, some dragons, horses, canines and felines, and even some bird creature. All of them not even paying attention to the you. You think to yourself "Jeeze.. I guess the he was right, we're just common place here..." This sends more worries to your mind.. thinking of what is going to happen next.

You start to feel less ashamed for being naked, seeing that nobody seems to care, you even saw a few naked anthros walking by, only they were lacking this dam collar.

You follow the brown and black Shepard into into what looks like a parking garage. Your feet began to hurt walking bare on the payment, but that was the least of your concerns.

You reached what must have been his car, same basic concept back on earth, 4 wheels and some doors, just an odd shape to it.

You glance up at the Canine, as he held what looked like the same controller he used on the collar, your hope were dismissed when you realize he just clicked it to open the car.

He turns around to you "Stay".
And just like that, you stopped following him.

He opens the drive door of looked to be a mid-sized sedan, and pulled a lever to open the trunk. He walked around towards it, and gave the command

"Come Here"

You body responded quicker then last time, probably by the fact that you are drained of energy and lack of moral.

You stopped less then a foot away from the beast.

"Get in the trunk" He asked.

As you body responded to the command, you asked the question

"Why do I need to go in the trunk?"

"Because you haven't been washed, and who knows where you have been" he responds smugly.


Your body crouches down, in a quite uncomfortable position, as he closes the trunk.

You hear the sound of an engine start, and the feeling of motion sway you side to side.


After what seemed like a 30min drive, the blinding light of the outside world bled through as The Shepard popped the trunk open again.

Your eyes took a few moments to adjust. The first thing you see is the tall anthro, but behind him...

You body instinctively does as its told follows Bilo back to where he came from. Bilo gets to his door and open it. Your blasted by heavy metal music... Bilo casually walks in, as you follow. He goes up to the massive stereo and turns it down... to a still very audible level.

"Welcome to you new home" says Bilo.

He then commands: Stick out your hand, palm up. You do so... by force. It also puts a lining in your stomach, causing you to be un-able to throw up. Even if you stick your finger down your throat, you wouldn't even gag. So eat up Cado!"

You body does as it's told and places the ball in you mouth. As soon as you bight down on it, its grainy texture breaks apart and completely dries out you mouth. You have trouble swallowing not only form the sawdust like taste but by the physical inability to swallow such a food.

"Alrighty then, now we can have some real fun"

Strangely enough, Long locks of pure white hair trailed down from the crown of it's head as it gently swayed behind its massive back. It was clear that the wolf, or wolfess to be precise, was female mainly due to the feminine features of it's light brown furred body. Just like a human being, she was adorned in an attire consisting of a sleeveless grey shirt and blue short. As your eyes were helplessly glued at the ginormous wolfess's body, it didn't take long to finally snap back to reality.

The sounds of loud thunderous booms begin to echo right before you as her massive furred feet were on a clear path towards your location. Terrified, you quickly turn your head about trying to spot some means of escaping possible death. To your ever-growing dread, you immediately notice that the edges of the massive sidewalks were way too far to reach in such a short time period. Before even having a chance of making a run for it, the wolfess's huge shadow soon looms high above you as her huge footsteps send you momentarily airborne. Shocked and unready to meet a sudden demise, you quickly curl up and clench your eyes shut hoping for a painless end. In just seconds, you suddenly manage to feel the immense power of her huge foot stepping down, though oddly enough a warm soft surface encasing your body.

Having no idea what it would be like after death, you continue to clench your eyes close unwilling to face the tragic fact. Just then however, another thunderous boom immediately catches your attention as your eyes bolt open in shock. To your surprise, you soon find yourself in an extremely soft yet confined area surrounded by fur. Upon further inspection, you quickly realize that this was the same color shade of the great wolfess. Whether it was a miracle or just shear dumb luck, you were still alive and breathing. With a deep unnerved sigh, you quickly gaze about once more trying to find out your strange whereabouts. Considering that the closest thing of her that made contact with you was her massive foot, it seemed as though of all places you were trapped between her massive toes. Immediately, you try to wiggle and pull your way out from the furred digits, but due to her massive body this ultimately proved futile. Or at least you thought it did.
12131.title: The massive Wolfess

choices: You try to call out to her once again
You decide to continue the climb
121312.content:
As you raise your eyes upwards from your stuck position, you notice that the huge wolfess was continuing on with her walk without even a single notice of your movements. With a slightly defeated sigh mixed with an irritated groan, you try once again to wiggle free from the furry confines between her toes. After one good tug and shake, you somehow manage to raise our upper torso just by a few inches. Undaunted and filled with newfound determination, you continue onwards with your struggles before finally managing to get both of your arms up and free. With your upper torso and arms escaping from the tight walls of fur, you soon place both of your hands upon the soft surface before trying your best to pull yourself free. As you attempt escape, the wolfess soon raises her foot back after making ground contact causing her to part her toes by just a small fraction. This small movement proved to be your ultimate benefit as your body soon manages to rise right out from the compressing fur.

With a victorious sigh, you quickly grip upon the nearest set of fur to avoid losing balance upon the huge foot. Once her foot returns back to the ground, you were quickly starting to regret escaping from her toes. In there, you didn't have to worry about getting thrown off by her sudden movements. Now however, you had no choice but to desperately hold on to her fur for dear life. "why did I even do this!?" you think aloud, as you cling on tightly from a sudden ascend. It was obvious that staying on the wolfess's foot was a terrible idea. There was no telling just how long you would be able to keep a steady grip from the walking motions, let alone just how far this ginormous canine planned on traveling. As you were crouching down from a quick falling motion, your head slowly raises upwards to gaze upon the wolf girls massive body. As your eyes trailed up her towering furry legs, a sudden idea came to mind. Maybe climbing her would be much safer then staying down on her feet?

Your eyes quickly widen over how ridiculous the idea sounded. Yet despite the overall stupidity of the notion, it did seem like the best bet to make. With a deep breath, you slowly begin to grasp tufts of long fur strands as you begin your ascension upwards. Her foot didn't seem like that much of a problem, considering that it was nothing more than a hill like slope. Though the sudden shifts in gravity and motion did manage to slow your pace tremendously. After what seemed like minutes of arduous climbing, you finally manage to clamber your way up to the start of her massive ankle. Just then however, the wolfess soon froze to a stop. Whether it was to take a break or admire the view was anyone's guess, yet regardless you quickly take this moment to recuperate from the climb. As you sit down exhaustingly while gathering your breath, another idea quickly springs back to your mind. Maybe since she wasn't moving she'd be able to finally hear you from below?
121312.title: She doesnt feel anything

choices: Climb up her shorts to rest
Climb in her shorts to rest
1213122.content:
As crazy as the idea sounded, it seemed like the best bet that you had was to continue scaling this massive wolf girl. If she was unable to hear you from down besides her feet, then there was no doubt at all that she wouldn't be able to hear you on her ankle. With a deep breath of air and long muscle stretch, you soon resume your ascension up the huge towering furry leg. To your surprise however, during your climb upwards it seemed much more easier to clamber your way up her calf compared to the unpredictable speed of her feet below. After what must've been about 10 or 20 minutes of climbing, you soon discover that you were making great progress on the lower section of her legs. However, just when enthusiasm was starting to cheer in your mind, you soon begin to feel light twinges of pain erupting from your biceps and shoulders. It seemed scaling her would truly be a test of your will and overall physique.

Another 20 minutes soon pass by as you finally manage to scale past her knee cap up to the bottom section of her huge thigh. At this time, your muscles were practically shouting for some sort of break in order to recuperate. In fact, your entire body was beginning to scream for some form of respite after the arduous ascent. While you really did wish to oblige to the painful requests your body was shouting, you knew all too well that stopping right upon the thigh would be a dangerous act to perform. If the movements weren't enough to toss your tired form straight towards the concrete ground, then trying your best to hang on to the soft wall of fur would surely send you, and your weak muscles to an early grave. You had to think of something fast. Some way to avoid succumbing to exhaustion as well as keeping you safe and alive.

While you were taking a quick breather with both hands tightly gripping a set of fur, you gaze up at the wolfess's upper body. Right before you was her massive pair of shorts, around half the distance of her ankle from your earlier travel. As awkward as it might sound, it seemed like your best bet would try to make your way to the fabric and use it as a sort of base for recuperating. The only problem was deciding just which path to take. You could attempt to continue your climb until you reach the waistband of her shorts, or the more awkward decision, you could try and squirm your way through the leg hole and rest within them. With your whole body starting to burn and course with pain, you had to make a decision quick.
1213122.title: Continuing the ascent

choices: She seems angered by your form.
12131221.content:
Despite the painful sensation overtaking your body, you decide to endure even more of the climb and attempt to scale the wolfess's huge shorts. You managed to make it this far up, so why not just try and make your way up towards her waistband for a break? With a deep breath and loud grunt, you raise your right hand upwards to grip the fabric of her shorts before pulling yourself upwards. Upon ascending only a few feet (to you at least) on the shorts, you suddenly feel your muscles begin to tense up in utter pain. A low grunt and gasp escapes as you exert some of the pain vocally, though that really didn't help much in your case. "Come on...just a bit-" With a great gasp, you soon find yourself gazing upwards as the wolfess's huge fingers slowly begin to descend towards you. "oh no...nonono!" You stammer as she appeared to be scratching an itch, which ironically happened to be your location.

Utterly shocked, you try your best to keep a steady grip before clenching your eyes close. Hopefully she wouldn't scratch you too hard with her fingers. And maybe, just maybe, you'd be able to avoid her claws. Upon holding a steady grip, you suddenly feel a solid force from behind beginning to poke you. Just as you were expecting the worst however, the object quickly retracts as a sudden gasp was heard above.

"W-What the?" a female voice stammers in shear confusion.

Equally confused, you slowly open your eyes to gaze up from your current position. Upon staring however, you quickly find the massive wolf girl's head gazing straight down at your form with wide eyes. A sudden gasp escapes your mouth as you quickly feel your blood begin to freeze inside your body. With your current position so high up, trying to release would certainly leave you badly injured, if not dead from the impact. To your horror, it seemed your current fate was within the lupine's hands.

After a second or two of silence, the wolf girl simply continues to stare down before lowering her right hand towards you. To weak to try and quickly move away, her huge fingers easily manage to wrap around your miniscule form before raising you skyward. Despite the terrifying predicament, it felt great to finally give your muscles a brief break from climbing. With shocked eyes and slightly agape mouth, you gaze upon the canine's huge face utterly terrified. Just then however, the massive girl begins to speak.

"What are you?" she asks.
12131221.title: Climb up her shorts to rest

121312211.content:
The question manages to leave you momentarily dazed. Here you were worried this wolfgirl would be enraged of your actions, let alone cruel towards creatures your size. Yet here she was asking a simple question. "What...am I?" you repeat the question in a quivering voice. "I'm...I'm a human." You reply back, trying to maintain a somewhat steady composure before her.

"A Hoomahn?" She replies, trying to pronounce the title. "What's a Hoomahn?" she asks as her expression grows even more confused than before.

"Well..." you stammer, unsure just how to explain it. "A human...is kind of like you." was the best thing you could use as an example. "Except we don't have fur...or snouts, or pointy ears or tails." you quickly add as she raises a brow from your definition.

"That's strange..." she murmurs. "I mean, you're around the same size as a mouse."

"Well...Humans aren't suppose to be this small...I think." you reply, uncertain just how tall a human would be considered in this strange world. "I mean, back in my world we're pretty tall and-" to your surprise, the wolfess gasps before bringing you closer to her face.

"Wait...did you say YOUR world?" she asks with wide eyes. "W-what do you mean by that?" she stammers, as if she suddenly grew excited by your words.

"E-errr yeah." you answer. "You see, I'm not from around here...so-"

The wolfess soon lets out a sudden gasp as her lips curl up into a sudden smile. "Oh my gosh!" she quickly stammers catching you off guard.

"W-what is it?" you ask, as your tenseness from before is soon replaced by utter confusion.

"Are you saying...you're some kind of Alien!?" she asks curiously. "Or maybe some sort of fairytale like creature?"

The question seemed to leave you completely dumbfounded as you gaze at her with a raised brow. "umm...I...guess you could consider me one of those." you reply back, uncertain just what to consider yourself on this world.

To your surprise, a loud squeal of excitement escapes the wolfess as she raises her shoulders in an excited fashion. "Oh my gosh! this is so cool!" she beams with a giggle.

"E-errr...what now?" you mutter, still uncertain what to make of her sudden reaction.

"You're an Alien...or fairy like creature! what's not to be excited about?" She asks in a soft tone, as if trying to contain her energy.

"Well...that would be exciting." you reply, throwing a random answer up to hide just how stupefied you were by her. "Listen...I...have no clue just how I got here, and I really need help at the moment. So, could you possibly help me out?"

The Wolfess continues to gaze down as the smile on her face seemingly grew. "Sure, in fact-"
121312211.title: The strange wolfess...

12133.content: Well how about a Big cat?
12133.title: Other

choices: I like the sound of that!
121331.content: So, how about a tiger or tigress to start off?
121331.title: Big cat choices

1213311.content: Now, what gender should this giant furry tiger be?
1213311.title: Tiger gender?

choices: was turning her head right down at you.
12133111.content:
As you were gazing about utterly dumbfounded from your strange predicament, A sudden quake begins to emerge below you. "W-What the!?" you stammer out loud as another quake soon follows in suit, much more powerful then the last. As you struggle to keep a steady footing upon the ground beneath you, your heart freezes knowing just what was possibly approaching. With you know miniscule in size, the inhabitants of this place must've rivaled the size of skyscrapers back home. Quickly, your head turns about trying to catch a glimpse of the oncoming person as the great tremors continue with their path. It wasn't too long before a great shadow casts over your location, catching your upmost attention.

With wide eyes and a slightly agape mouth, You find yourself gazing at what appeared to be a female. Yet unlike other girls back on earth, This stranger carried a set of orange and white fur all about her body. stripes were decorated in an almost rhythmic pattern upon her limbs as a tiger head replaced that of a human. On her head rested a great long set of light brown locks that elegantly flew down her crown. Like a human being she also wore a set of clothing, mainly that of simple long sleeved shirt and blue denim jeans. As you continue to gaze up at the abnormal creature, you soon notice her stopping a few yards from your location.

"Hmmm?" You hear her mutter from high above as her head seemed to look about her location. To be honest, you found it quite odd how some random tigress girl stood perfectly still right before you. That was...unless she somehow managed to be aware of your presence. As you continue to stare up at her, you soon manage to hear what almost sounded like rhythmic huffs escaping her. it didn't take long to notice that she was actually sniffing about. Unsure whether your location was the best or not right before her, you slowly begin to step back towards the fields of grass behind you. After a few steps back however, you soon find that she-
12133111.title: The Tigress

121332.content:
Okay, so you'd definitely prefer your adventure to involve a giant canine?

Very well, how about a German Shepherd?
121332.title: Stick with the Big Dogs

choices: Bruno’s butt started to get sweaty
You started to slide down Bruno’s crack
121332212.content:
You nearly screamed at the sight of this massive creature it’s chocolate brown eyes stared back at your dark blue ones. Well well well look at what I’ve got here a little human, the Doberman girl said smiling mischievously between the giants fingers you were shaking like a like a leaf “please don’t hurt me, you begged which seem to make her gaze soften a bit.

Hey don’t worry I’m not gonna hurt you little guy my names Bruno what’s yours? The Doberman smiled “my names john it’s nice to meet you, you said nervously “well John the pleasures all mine but I’m afraid we’re gonna have to cut this conversation short.

You cocked your head to the side “um why if you don’t mind me asking, the Doberman gave you a gentle smile “well you see I’m kinda in a hurry to get back home and I’ll be jogging all the way so I’m gonna have to put you somewhere for the time being.

You couldn’t help but be a little nervous “and where would that be? Bruno smiled mischievously “it’s easier if I just show you, Bruno brought you to her bubble butt and pulled back her sweat pants and thong.

Try not to struggle too much little guy I’m ticklish back there, Bruno said before dropping you. You screamed a little from the drop but you were fine when landed on her thong but the bad thing is because of the angle it was place in it was just like a slide sliding you between Bruno’s cheeks.

Once Bruno felt you reach her cheeks she let her sweatpants and thong go which caused them to catapult you further into her butt you were now a few metres away from her ring of flesh “oh got could things get any worse.
121332212.title: Female

choices: Climb on and hitch a ride!
122.content:
You saw a Lynx! A cat! A "small" cat, and yet it dwarfed you by far! Figure for the sake of round-ness and worst-case, an inch to him is 200 feet to you, that creature's animal counter-part on your scale was a 2 foot long midget, but before you it was at least 14000 feet tall, now counting the ears, making him a contender to be 3 miles tall. Most sky-scrapers weren't a 7th of his height, and most states could be crossed in an hour at the pace he had.

Speaking of pace, the creature was closing in fast, even though he may well have just been walking. Every second you were craning your neck higher up to see the top of him. In what seemed an instant, four digitigrade toes towering at least 400, and maybe 700 feet into the sky filled your view. Claws the size of sky-scrapers dominated your view and despite their size, were small enough to pierce your flesh rather than crush it. So low you were that the miniscule distance that the pads held the feet above ground seemed like a cavern to you.

Suddenly....
122.title: Large Lynx

1223.content:
Enormous masses of fur and flesh were about to crush you when suddenly, a small furry came at you, a blur to your eyesight and tackled you with the force of a small train. Physics kicked in and both of you were sent rolling off to the edge of the sidewalk not all that far away. The titan scale toes stopped there, too close for comfort, perhaps their owner searching for you?

Before taking a chance on anything like that, you stand up to thank your hopefully new found friend. Remarkably, its a Lynx, just a bit shorter than you are. As you stare at him, you see his paw flash and become a fur-covered hand. From head to toe his yellow and white fur is covered in dirt, presumably from never taking a bath or not having time for it.

"Quick! We must hurry!" the creature said, grabbing your arm and trying to pull you along, though you resisted as he headed back in the direction of the giant. A close-up on those toes wasn't on your to-do list...
1223.title: A little lynx too?

12231.content:
"Your world is gone, there is no way back" the creature said, continuing to pull, "survival outside is almost impossible, a bug on your world is enormous here. The safest place, is on him."

With that, the Lynx let go and ran off, it seemed that survival out here was rather impossible given there was nothing small enough for you to even kill for food and it'd take days to get a dent in the skin of any berries or plant life. If there were regular animals here, it was more likely that the hunter would be the hunted or just get crushed, and a bug, most would be somewhere between the size of your house and the neighborhood or bigger. Weather wasn't even on your side, a light breeze was a hurricane gale and a drop of water was a pretty darn big pond, the millions in even a small drizzle could make oceans of mud now miles deep.

There was no choice, you followed the other lynx, at a dead run. Movement was almost impossible, the grooves and imperfections of the cement were paths you were forced to run through. Easily you could remember walking on millions of sidewalks and never noticing, at the most, you'd known that a sidewalk felt rough underfoot. At the time of course, your feet weren't in the range of 1/175th of an inch long.

At the moment, it was beyond understanding why the enormous Lynx had stood there so long, but that wasn't mattering much as you were right at the smaller of them and ready to ascend. Between you were several strands of fur, they were more like buildings than an insulator, but were the way up. Your companion was already ascending, like a little rocket.

Climbing had never been your strong area, and now being naked as you did it was making it worse. Images of girls laughing below came to mind, a reminder from school. Of course, football and soccer had always been the thing, not shimmying up frigging ropes.That was stuff for cheer leaders and kids, stuff that was a waste of time.
12231.title: Friend

122312.content:
Luck had been on your side, the climb went quickly and whatever held up the giant, it did so long enough for both yourself and the other Lynx to get onto the mountains that were called toes. Things stayed good too, as the Large Lynx walked rather than ran, it was hard enough to hold on as things were, each step generating plenty of force to hurl you off. More than anything, it was your companion that kept you there, his claws had no effect to the giant but were plenty to hold him down and then dig in and anchor you.

A good while later, you arrived at the creature's house, or at least what you thought was his house. At the steps, you thought for a second you saw a human-like pair of flipflops and sandals, but could not be sure. Inside, the giant proceeded up a set of steps and then left down a hall way. It was all huge, you were certain a city or even state could fit in here and have room to spare.

"This is our stop" the smaller lynx said, running forward, grabbing you and boldly jumping over the edge. Oddly though, the descent was not all that fast, but rather slow. In fact, you felt nearly nothing at the landing. Quickly he said, "we're like particles, being so small, gravity almost doesn't apply to us."

All around, the wooden floors continue on as if they never ended, miles upon miles of them. There were doors though, with a kilometer or more gap between their bottoms and the floor. It all seemed familiar though, the layout of the house, the area, everything, even from this low angle. All of a sudden, your examination ended as yet again, the Lynx hauled you off, to the side of the hall and across a series of bridges of various materials, most of it so small they needed a microscope to be seen. However, these every-day materials were the only way between floor-boards, seemingly smooth if you were big, but greatly separated at this level.

Inside the room, you were hauled under a piece of furniture of some sort before you saw the room. Under this there were all sorts of toys, but you couldn't figure out what most were from the perspective of a piece of dust as even a small action figure or plastic doll was a giant beyond imagining. You went to demand an explanation, but one was practically thrown at you.

"I'm Felix, and welcome to your new and for that matter, old home" Felix said, launching into an explanation that would have made a squierrel's chatter seem slow. "This is a universe, or really, a reality that does not create its own life, but takes if from others. Each reality is how things could have gone different, there are infinite numbers of them, most life develops at the same size and either is shrunken getting here or was just that small to begin with. There are many of these realities, but despite the differences, people stay together. This is your house, as it is also mine, in my world, I was your cousin. That Lynx, was you. By your lack of dress, I am going to guess you shrank coming here. A few days ago, your siblings here died, I imagine yours in your world are now here as well, but far larger. That giant nearly died, which is why you are here and likely small. Unfortunately, everyone who comes here has a slight attitude change if they keep their size, the biggest change is either an ignorance for us, a need to enslave us or being outright evil to us."

Suddenly, the door opens, a furry set of paws and then a human foot enter. For just a second, you see the toe-nails, they are...
122312.title: Home

1223121.content:
There was no paint on the enormous foot, but plenty of mud and grass. No doubts about it, this was you 'little' five year old brother, Tom. He loved running in the dirt, didn't wear shoes out there and didn't always understand the difference between little toy and little animal or thing. That meant the huge things down here were everything from GI-Joes to socks to shoes to any boyhood toy, but even the smallest of them was like a skyscraper.

At the edge of the furniture, whatever this was, you craned you neck up in the hopes of seeing something beside a death-machine for a brother. Unfortunately, all you saw were feet, leg and muddy clothes. His feet, luckily were not like the Lynx's but were smaller, though longer. Without the mud, you figured at the toes he was 300 feet tall and by the ankle could be as much as a thousand. This was not a particularly pleasing though, the kid you had tortured as all older brothers must do to the little ones, was now like a walking city to you.

"Have you ever talked with the giants?" You quickly ask Felix, wanting to talk with one of them and maybe see being friends and getting along.

"Are you mad! That's suicide!" Felix yelled, though both of you were small enough that about one thing was going to hear you. That one thing was the gigantic Lynx, who could spot a mouse from 200 meters away and hear almost anything, but you weren't sure if he could hear you or what he would do.

"Then how do you know all this?" you ask, grabbing your 'cousin' by the neck, through all the fur you put enough pressure on it to give him reason to fear for his life.

"City people, they flee the place for their lives, tell of the horror stories" he hastily answered before forcing his way out of your grip and backing off.

There is a sudden movement and you are forced to retreat, and fast. The human giant is coming this way, his titanic toes slipping in the very gap you occupy, unaware he was going to kill his directly related brother. Just narrowly, you avoid the rock-hard wall of flesh, it seems more like a machine than a person. In front of it, you look up at the mud in the huge gaps between the toes, on the toes and all over, not to mention the sweat. An enormous ammount of it falls to the ground, making small mountains, though really it isn't anywhere near the full ammount.
1223121.title: Bigger Brother

12231211.content:
There was only one solution here, it wasn't like a math problem that would spit out a million answers to X and Y. More information was needed in order to continue. If there was going to be hiding in fear, then there would be reasons besides the odds of accidentally being crushed.

Looking left and right, your view moves between the giant Lynx and Tom's foot. On the right, you see mud, uck and general gross slop. However, at the top of that enormous tower, there was someone who should be very close to you and well known. However he may also not hear you or have the toy-problem and think of you as fragile as a toy, though he may also get vengance, at his size, you couldn't stop him if that was the way it went.

On the left, however, your sights saw a much bigger and stronger creature, not that strength was much of a factor anymore, anything could disturb dust. Well, anything but yourself as a spec of dust could well be as big as a house or a semi. Moving up and down, you know the fur will be easier to climb, but that the beast will also be more active. There was also the fact that you knew yourself the best, though he was a different you. How well would you know him? Of course, he had better chances of hearing you with the couple thousand feet of radar-dome like ears.

Still naked, you run to the giant, his toes alone made you a speck when held up to comparison for size, and there wasn't a single muscle in him as small as your entire body. Raw force against spec.
12231211.title: Just like Jack and the Bean Stalk

122312111.content:
Tom was way to dangerous, maybe you would try him you didn't have to look up to see his toe-nails, or for that matter if you were big enough to do anything. There was however, no chance of that happening, so it was to your giant counterpart you went.

The gigantic fur-ball was holding still, it seemed now would be your only chance to catch him as otherwise there would be miles to cross before getting this close. By sprinting, the distance was covered, as you got closer, you looked farther and farther up to see him. For a few seconds, your thoughts turned to imaging being that big, that strong but found in truth you had been until today. You always had been taller than your little brother, you always had been able to hurl a toy like it was a little rocket, you always had crushed bugs, you always had been that strong.

At the titanic toes, all this thinking ended as a problem was discovered. There was no way up, here you were at the base of a creature weighing a million tons but lacking a way up him. Earlier, a strand of fur had reached the ground, but now, they were all teasing you by ending 50 feet overhead and a few came as low as 10 feet over your head. To the giants, there was no difference in distance, but to you it was the difference between getting up there and being stranded in the middle of the floor of a giant boy's room. A few times that giant had stepped back during your run, which left you now far from any cover.

Frantically looking around, you finally spot the pads. By now you've walked as far as the middle toe and have no choice but to try and scale that center piece of fleshy protection before your counterpart takes another step. Hurredly you run at it and jump on, fitting into the grooves that formed a distinct paw-print, then jumping up to climb onto the next. All the time doing this, the enormous mass covered you in sweat, which was coated on thicker than you were. It felt like climbing a cold waterfall of salty grime.

In a seeming eternity, but possibly just minutes, you'd reached the top. Here fur ran all over flatly as it was pushed against the paw by an enormous weight. These pieces of fur made the perfect bridges, but you doubted their ability to hold you. The option to turn back is however removed in an instant as the ground disappeared, then it was back but it was like the view out from an airplane's landing gear, like seeing a whole country-side. Each step was well into the thousands of feet up.

Suddenly, everything came up and you were deafened by an enormous explosion, really it was the sound of a step. On the ground, things moved as the toes splayed before being picked up again to repeat the process. Quickly, you jumped out onto the nearest piece of fur and started making for the nearest edge. If 'you' started running, there was no way to hold on to the pads or the fur, a higher and better perch was needed.

Sweaty black foot prints marked your path along the enormous pathways, like catwalks and bridges across the sky. At some places you could run right to the next spot, others you couldn't and had to jump or find another way. Despite the giant's walking, you kept your balance and did not fall off, something to this day that is a mystery to you. There was no time to stop for a breather as at last you reached a piece of fur going vertically, though a thought about it would have been wise.

As you climbed up, you realized you were in one of the worst places possible, between the toes. Splayed or closed there was plenty of room, but if he wiggled them for any reason, you were certain that the fur would become a much more active crushing agent. Still, you climbed up, through muck and grime, dirt and more. At one point, you found a 'pebble' now a 300 foot tall boulder wedged in and found there was an identical but smaller one between your own toes. You plucked it out and threw it, imagining doing the same thing to this one.

Suddenly the steps stopped and you were forced to hang on to whatever you could to avoid being hurtled across wherever you were. The foot was now upright so that the heel was down and you could walk on the gap between the toes like this was a giant valley. Running, you reached the cliff like end of the toes, there was an enormous drop to the leg and then everything became a landscape of clothes and fur heading up the giant's body. "You" were lying in bed with your feet propped up and back against a mountain of pillows and some gaming implement in hand. At the moment, you were only a couple hundred feet up the toes and having thousands more to go, 3 miles of a furry you.
122312111.title: 3 Miles of Me

1223121111.content:
"Hey, you!" you yell at the top of your lungs, after just that first shout, it feels like your lungs are gone, that was as loud as you'd ever been. "A little help."

Your heard, but barely. The giant Lynx puts his toy down and starts looking around for a little person, probably thinking its a creature that was naturally small from another world, perhaps a friend from his own. In all the looking though, he doesn't move much more than his head and upper body, possibly trying to look without crushing.

"I'm on you!" you yell again, not as loudly as the first time, "big foot."
1223121111.title: Talking with a giant

12231211111.content:
Everything moves as suddenly the giant legs straighten out and he bends forward to get a look at his feet, which to him are just that and to you comprise a mountainous forest. His face can't remotely get that close without a lot of moving and probably killing of you. Off to the sides, you see his enormous arms pick up and close in, under the fur you can clearly see enormous muscles, as yours once had been.

"Left foot, between middle toes!" you yell, there are four of the mountains, but you are unsure which side of the middle you are on. An absolutely enormous hand closes in on the foot, claws coming out and one nearly crushes you but just misses, quickly you climb up to avoid an further risk of crushing.

The hand moves up as the whole giant shifts to be comfortable again, he brings you right in front of his enormous eye with a quick layover at the mouth. In his mouth, you see spires of enormous teeth, built for predators but also plenty good at crushing cities and skyscrapers that would be midgets next to them. Easily you can see him destroying a whole city in there, though perhaps you head was picturing a city smaller than it was.

"I can't see you" the giant booms, it almost seems as if it is the enormous green eye talking as it passes from side to side, but is unable to spot you.

"I'm here, just really tiny, your something like three miles tall to me" you yell, looking around and finding that you blend in with the many imperfections of the claw. A giant would have a hard time finding the small pathways and bump or two, but they were plainly visible to you. "If Felix told the truth, I am you from another world. I just shrank getting here. My brother though seems to have come in fine and full-sized."

"That explains that strange pile of clothes I found earlier," the lynx said, "I came here like that too. I got normal by luck, sometimes a portal shows up from here to here. They can go both ways though I'm afraid, watch you don't go through one and get any smaller."

Your view shifted as the claw came around to sit you in the enormous ears, they were huge, stretching far into the sky. A radar dome like that would be used to detect frigging planets, small radar units picked up big stuff, big ones picked up huge stuff. "Any idea where to find one of these?" you ask, not yelling though, surely up here he'd hear you fine.

"Normally around people who've recently crossed over" he answers, "one could form around you, but the odds are really good with your brother, sister and that girlfriend of his, and that one of yours too."

"Has anyone ever controlled them?" you ask, hoping to find a road home by controling whatever portal you find between the worlds. Get home and get there fast.

"A few tries, but that's it" he answers again, "supposedly you can do it once or twice with your mind."
12231211111.title: All Friends Here

122312111111.content:
An ark of lightning hit the ground right in front of you, it seemed to come out of nowhere and make no noise. It was just like when you got here, minus a detail or two. There was nothing there, but if you crossed through, maybe it would grow you. The odds were only fifty-percent if that, but that was as good as it would ever get.

"there's a portal, I think, I'm going for it" you yell, "its right in your ear."

Without a seconds hesitation after saying that, you jump through the hovering disturbance that was just sitting in the air. You blacked out going through it, but come out....
122312111111.title: Strange Luck

1223121111112.content:
Coming around, you see an enormous furry foot in front of you, but at the same time, the cavern of the large lynx's ear, at least what of it you can see. At the moment, the scales have tipped drastically against you and an inch is closer to 5000 feet than it has to being an inch. The ear your in is deep enough to probably hold a city, at the least, it seems like it.

Standing up, your attention is once more drawn to the enormous furry foot. Looking up, you see it is Felix! Earlier he had been far, far shorter than you and nowhere near as strong. A second or two ago, you were a giant compared to this, and the giants, it was best not to think about them. 1/25th of 1/25th of an inch tall, or possibly even a bit worse, either way it was not good for you.

Quickly, you run up to Felix, your actions seem like de'ja vu. When you start the climb though, you realize it is not. His feet are buried in mud and dirt, he may well have been worse than Tom. The climbing up furs thing though is getting old, you've been doing it all day long. By the time you make it up onto a toe, the titan is on the move. He walks by strands of fur that are big to him but to you, they're just enormous, hands-down gigantic.

After a second or two, your attention is shaken back to the present and the current enormous fur your surrounded by. It seemed a little on the ridiculous side right now, but that was that. Being on a forest of fur walking through an almost identical forest of fur. Of course earlier, you'd pinned this forest against a wall, now the weight of a single toe or a piece of fur would make you flatter than any pancake.
1223121111112.title: Full-sized Felix

choices: Leaves you in a worse fate
12231211111121.content:
Constant motion was a big problem to microscopic life, particularly one thing trying to climb a bigger thing that was on the move. It just didn't work. The enormous movements Felix took to climb down your counterpart, then the bed and then just to walk made progress impossible for you. All the effort at hand was just on keeping on the beast.

What seemed hours later, it was darker and cooler all around along with a deafening roar that seemed familiar. After climbing a stalk of fur, a very interesting fact was revieled, your cousin had taken you outside or at the least he had gone outside. Earlier, this place was a scary environment, but now it was horrifying as nothing could be smaller than you and anything bigger would be like a walking country block. There was one piece of good news and that was an abundance of shelter, the smallest holes were caves, and there were probably billions of caves as a result.

"Alright cous'" a voice booms from overhead, "I saw the portal, I know you didn't grow but I'd bet you shrank and are on me now. Where are you?"

Hurredly, you scale a strand of fur and start yelling up "I'm down here! Here!"

Felix hears a shrill yell, it is barely understandable but coming from the ground. Having been in similar positions, he knew how and where to look, quickly finding the amazingly micro you. Things now became bad, a claw was not offered, but two of the enormous things caught you like titanium vices. A quick ascent forced miles to dissolve quickly, leaving you far into the air of a vengeful "friend."
12231211111121.title: Not so friendly feline

122312111111211.content:
"I've always wanted my own slave" Felix said, dangling you right in front of his mouth as he walked towards a huge hole in the distance. It was Tom's toe-print, at least an old one at the base of a plant, a mountain of grass. "But, I can't watch you tonight, I might just be finding a portal."

The titan walked down slope into the pit, it was several miles to you from the start of the slope to where it became level at the base. This was a result of dirt washing from the top into it and lengthening the expanse, not to mention the dirt settling over-time. At the plant, Felix stomped, pushing down until his whole foot was well under the dirt. As his foot was removed, you were dropped as fast as you had come up to land in the enormous footprint, dead-center in a lake of sweat from the center pad. Your pit was a few thousand feet deep, assuming you could swim through the mucky-sweat and start climbing the walls.

"What out for the bugs" Felix said, walking away. His steps created earthquakes as he left, putting you in a miniature storm at sea. "Just about all of them are way bigger than me and that's a lot bigger than you. They seem to have a thing for the night."

That fact was quite true, a worm's diamter was significantly greater than Felix and thousands of feet to you, an ant's leg was probably bigger around than this whole footprint and a single rain-drop would go a very long way to flooding the hole created by Tom's toes. You moved off towards the far off walls as fast as your micorscopic feet could kick to take you. In the grand scheme, that was not very far.
122312111111211.title: Planted

1223121111112111.content:
The night passes by peacefully, no gigantic bugs attack, nothing falls from the sky to crush you or anything else harmful. At the worst you just couldn't sleep because of the booming of giant insects walking around or the immense bass sound of the crickets. These problems kept you up, loud noises, fear of attack, and even to an extent, a fear about exposure as you had yet to find clothes this tiny. Admittedly if a girl were to show up you'd be embarrased despite being so small that you couldn't be seen, let alone anything like that.

Finally though, the morning has arrived. At first you are greeted by extreme hunger as you wake and stand, but then there is something worse. Lakes start to fall out of the sky. Really, its dew from the plant overhead dripping off the leaves, but that's a good quarter to half inch diameter of water which on your scale is a couple thousand feet. It would be a welcome opportunity to wash away the sweat from Felix's paws along with all the grime, but you also wanted to live through that and right now, the water around you was heavy enough that it'd make you a piece of paper on impact.

Running along the edge of the paw print as fast as you can, you try to outrun the coming water. Your feet splash in the shallow lake of sweat, at least shallow here, if you were to slip, the landing would be in a section well over your head. Its a race against time and gravity, far off there's a section of pad-print without any leaves over it and thats the objective.

By luck and probably a slurry of new medical disorders, you reach the safe area and immediately collapse on the ground there. Hours could have passed as you laid there and it was all good until you were interupted. Five soft shapes patted on your back, trying to rouse you. It was a feline foot, and on your scale.

Rolling over, you find Felix, whatever portal he used, it did the same to him as yours did to you. Before he can say a word, you grab the foot still hovering in mid-air from an interrupted attempt to shove at you. Ordinarily this would've been gross but as your whole body had been there it wasn't anymore. As you stand, you ram you fingers at the toes and start to spread them wider than they were meant to go and simultaneously push back. Your thoughts struck for a second that it was funny to have the foot that made this crater be in your hands and in the crater.

At the edge of the water, you shove with all your might and send the little lynx into the pools of his own sweat from his pads that now formed masses far larger than his whole body. Looking down, its funny to see him come to shore looking like a drowning,but oddly yellow rat. Though a rat was also far larger than this little spot as well, a rat wouldn't drown here.

Felix was once more smaller than you, there were a few things that could be done...
1223121111112111.title: Micro-felix

12231211111121112.content:
Felix comes ashore dripping wet and right over to you, "Listen, I want to work together, my plan failed and well, the only fix takes two."

"A fix!" you yell, "my furry equivalent up there has feet that touch four or maybe seven inches of ground, If the rest of the world were this small, he'd be stepping on states. How do you fix, this!"

"I had what I knew of portals all wrong" Felix said, "you have to go through a little creature's portal, to grow."

"So what' we're gonna find a big portal and shrink you so you get to be big, using me" you answer him, pissed that he was gonna likely leave you behind.

"Well, that's the thing, they don't have to be smaller than you, it just has to be a portal from a tiny or if you really try with a giants you need to be nearly infinitismal." Felix says, "I figure one of us grows using the other and we repeat the process until we are larger than this."

As he outlines an exact plan, a portal opens right in front of you at the edge of the water. You are stopped from entering it by a quick line from your cousin, "that'll shrink one of us. its not physically attatched to us, so its created by a series of forces and we attract those forces."
12231211111121112.title: Work together

122312111111211121.content:
"If it grows things in the end, I'm going" you say and walk over to the portal. Before going through you pull a metal band off your leg, you'd had it for years and figure if this works on both of you, you'll get it back and are truthfully curious to see something of yours, being huge. "Hold onto this, I just wanna see something besides giant furballs. Leave it on the ground and I'll climb onto it."

This little piece of metal is one of the few articles you still owned, you kinda figured that electrical charges kept it with you. When you crossed realities a charge of energy would have had to changed your molecular status just a bit and the conductive metal took part of that charge. Reguardless of how it worked out, Felix takes it and there you stand at the portal.

Reluctantly you face the portal and jump through....



An instant later you are spat out, you land at the edge of your own footprints, going by them you are a just under a sixty fourth of an inch tall.... compared to Felix. Compared to the normal sized objects you do not exist, your just that small to them. After this all flies through your head, you black out.

When you come to, it is still dark. You look up to see the enormous feet of your cousin, specifically their undersides as he appears to be laying down. The metal band you gave him was right in front of his enormous center pads (his feet were one on top of the other, he was on his side), which you guessed to cover 2000 feet across and a bit less than that in length.
122312111111211121.title: Real small

choices: somewhere in a forest of fur
1223121111112111212.content:
It turns out that Felix is not a calm sleeper. You had started walking towards the band at his feet when suddenly the enormous things he called paws came flying at you. The gravel and sandy dirt was pushed high into a mountain in front of you and closing in.

Had you been normal sized, this of course would not have been a problem. When a foot dwarfs a city's tallest buildings however, it moves immense ammounts of material, leaving you to try and outrun a 3 or 4 mile leg as it pushed downwards. In that, you failed and are ultimately carried up the mountain by the dirt piling on.

The instant that finishes, the cat's foot comes in again as he rolls over. Your quickly in a forest of 640 foot tall fur, if its not even larger. Dirt shoots at you as your forced to cling to a strand of that fur for your life. He rolls over again and curls into a fetal position after that, but the force shoots you off and up towards his bare chest. After his swim, he took his shirt off for it to dry.

There you look up his front side to see a wall of abs there going up over a mile. A second later he rolls and you get a close up on those mountains along with the dirt. This goes on for teh whole night...
1223121111112111212.title: Moving sleeper

choices: Well ahead of the times, 1/25th of an inch
12231211111121112121.content:
The next morning you come to in an odd position. Your back is arched in a funny angle, your legs are all but sticking straight up but your head is laying way back. It takes a few seconds, but slowly you wake up and see what's happened. Somehow, in the night, you went through another portal. Your memories are fuzzy, like you'd been awake and gotten a good bump on the head.

Looking around, you find yourself to be...
12231211111121112121.title: Definitely Exponential

122312111111211121211.content:
You were in that giant toe-print it barely held you, so you were somewhere just over an inch tall. To Felix, that was massive, hundreds of thousands of miles. Look around, you wonder just where he was. Given what time you'd gone to sleep last night, there were quite a few places he could be. It easily boiled down though to three things: on you, around you, or under you.

Slowly, carefully, you got up, trying to avoid any disaster for the nano-scaled cat. Not that he didn't deserve some sort of payback... Despite his microscopic size, you being looking for him...
122312111111211121211.title: The one-inch giant

122312111111211121212.content:
At first when you came to, you weren't so big. Around you was Felix's footprint, inside it you were laying but big enough that it seemed only a foot and a half deep. A bit of moving and again you passed out. It seemed whatever kind of portal made things bigger it either played with your head or did it in parts.

A while later, when you at last wake and come to, your in an open pit, that gigantic one from your 'little' brother. Rolling over and looking down, you find that Felix's footprint, that which had been for soo long your prison, was now not even as large as your hand. Down in there somewhere was something around 1/25th of an inch tall and it had stood here while a little you had been in there.

Looking down, you examine and look around the foot print in search of a bright tan, going on yellow organism. "Come on shortie, where are you" you call, to be answered...
122312111111211121212.title: De'ja Reverse vu?

1223121111112111212121.content:
"Who're you calling shortie" you hear boom from above. Turning and looking up you see its Felix and he's grown to beyond normal and has got to be around seven or eight feet tall. Of course it would figure that he'd get the luck and grow to be the biggest of you in the end as odds were now that he wasn't going to be any kind of help. It seemed at least he got the most of the bargain, growth to what he had percieved as being nearly three miles and you going down to what you had considered near non-existent for most of your life.

"Now, you oughta know something" Felix boombed again, "I hate being small and I hated it more being so tiny compared to you and your duplicate."

You look down along the gigantic creature and focus on his feet, five inches tall on a normal scale and just around a thousand feet on yours. You wiggle your toes and imagine being in such a position and kinda which you had. In that case at least you'd get some kind of payback, epecially given that you'd been the smallest thing here from the start. At first just taller than Felix and far near nothing compared to your 'little' brother and furry self here, and then looking up at Felix as you did now and normal things as beyound understanding.

"Last night, you nearly killed me too" Felix said, "you became an absolute giant and I nearly got crushed under what I thought was massive and gigantic. Now you can see massive and gigantic."

You saw one of the enormous feet lift up, titanous toes filling your vision. And worst of it, none could even fit in this space, not even a single pad. Your 'little' pit and it wasn't even something he could distinguish as being a drop in the ground. Blackness filled in the sky overhead.
1223121111112111212121.title: Damn Lucky Lynx

122312111111211122.content:
You'd seen a giant Felix before and did not trust him being larger than you. Odds were he had told the truth about the portal though and that was all it took to set your mind. He was gonna look up for a change.

"As much as I'd love to get even smaller" you say stepping towards the already little lynx (he was quite a deal shorter than you afterall), "I think I'd like to look down for once." With that, you shove him and he goes flying through the portal, the last of him you see is a foot coming up to balance him as he goes past the even horizon.

That done, you sit down and then lay back just where you were. Felix had until you wanted to leave, to get on and after that he was to be left behind. It was still night and after a bit of struggling, you fell asleep.

Unknown to you at the time, Felix had come out and was just now coming to as you went out. Now, the downside about these portals is that they have an exponential effect. Smaller objects are effected the most. He looked up at your barefeet black from all the running around on dirty surfaces and saw over a mile wide and many tall...
122312111111211122.title: Way Little Lynx

1223121111112111222.content:
The nigh was pretty peaceful, for you at least. Later on you would find out that Felix would spend it amid your toes, each one measured in over a mile. His sense of scaled sucked, but in the end that's what he said it was. In the night, it had been hard on him, your body seeming to automatically tortue him with 'you-quakes', wiggling toes and movnig around.

The next morning however, you awoke to see an enormous black pad in your face...
1223121111112111222.title: Big Cat by morning

12231211111121112221.content:
Moving around, you saw that Felix was indeed bigger, but not by as much as you would have expected. His inch was just about 20 feet to you. That giant black pad was indeed huge, but really against bigger things he wasn't that much. He was also still asleep.

Sick and tired of feet and rather than sit here to risk an encounter that would be all too close, you climbed along his toes like a ladder, much fur yanking and jumping involved. It came to you reaching the top of his foot and walking along, up his body, which was in some senses, a sky scraper. It was also a forest, as you ventured along through thick fur all around him.

Now if only a portal would show up for you, but not just yet. So, you just continued along. At his pits things got a bit tricky, you weren't going in there. For once though, the simple solution just worked. Dropping to the side, you just moved along from piece of fur to piece fo fur and eventually end up getting to his head. It was indeed huge, but as far as you were concerned was hollow. Now here came an interesting choice: wake him up or wait until he comes to. His ears were right there, very sensitive and you'd be mroe than loud enough standing in them.
12231211111121112221.title: Not so exponential...

choices: A Portal opens up before Felix wakes up.
122312111111211122212.content: The waiting game seemed like a better choice. Plus the portal will come, only when it wants to, so you might as well get some rest. Being this size has exhausted you. You keep climbing to get out of immediate danger if he gets up and find a spot on top of his head to fall asleep.
122312111111211122212.title: Waiting...

1223121111112111222121.content:
You feel the ground below shake, forcing you out of your sleep, in your groggy state of mind you thought "Earthquake". But the unfortunate reality came flooding back into your mind. You were tiny, probably only a quarter of inch to the Lynx who was still small yet.

Felix was stirring, he opened his eyes unaware of the small human perched on his head, though he figured he'd be somewhere on his person. He hadn't grown as big as he would have liked to, but it was a step forward from his minuscule size earlier. And now with a plan in motion, he, you both and something to wait for.

All appears to be going well, especially when the portal opens up.
1223121111112111222121.title: Felix wakes up

choices: A normal inch tall (~100 miles tall)
Back to a normal micro (1/25th of a normal inch)
12231211111121112222.content:
Slowly moving around, your soon realizing just how giant that pad was and how close to death you were. At first, you were sure it was nothing but alll of the giant black-things lined up just right to look gigantic. When you moved, you saw a single pad for your friend's toe and it was just going on and on and on. It was a good thing that he hadn't come out any closer to you, otherwise the world would have one less human, for sure.

Getting away and putting in some distance between yourself and the Giant, you figured he was....
12231211111121112222.title: Look up

122312111111211122221.content:
Moving around, you at least see that Felix is well over a hundred miles tall to you. You were 1/25th of an inch tall to something 1/25th of an inch tall, so it did sort of make sense. At least you had survived to this point. Easily that growth could've killed you underfoot, fur or otherwise.

Up overhead you saw massive toes two or three miles long at the very least. The center pad was 8 and a half miles across, and you'd have to climb all of it to get to safety. Around down here it was too easy to be trapped in a paw-print or trampled and at that by something which had been SMALLER than you mere hours ago! One of these turns, it'd be a giant you and stay like it for a while.

Before you can grumble and gripe any more, Felix stirs, his massive feet moving and titanous toes twitching as he comes to. Quickly and without a second thought, you run forward, up a small mountain of dirt and jump onto a foot. Hurredly you climb and try to get to what will soon be the side, unfortunately it is not to be as one at a time each gigantic food goes into the sky and turns to come down flat. Your forced flat into the skin, but manage to at least slide between two toes.

A boom erupts and wind flies underfoot for Felix, but he doesn't even know it. You can tell he is examining and looking over the world, something that is all so tiny to him, surely many little routes and details that are now too tiny to dream of seeing. Your hugging and holding to whatever you can as you await something to happen that will send you flying.
122312111111211122221.title: One big kitty

choices: Normal-sized Felix (same size as your counterpart)
1223121111112112.content:
The night passes by peacefully, no gigantic bugs attack, nothing falls from the sky to crush you or anything else harmful. At the worst you just couldn't sleep because of the booming of giant insects walking around or the immense bass sound of the crickets. These problems kept you up, loud noises, fear of attack, and even to an extent, a fear about exposure as you had yet to find clothes this tiny. Admittedly if a girl were to show up you'd be embarrased despite being so small that you couldn't be seen, let alone anything like that.

Finally though, the morning has arrived. At first you are greeted by extreme hunger as you wake and stand, but then there is something worse. Lakes start to fall out of the sky. Really, its dew from the plant overhead dripping off the leaves, but that's a good quarter to half inch diameter of water which on your scale is a couple thousand feet. It would be a welcome opportunity to wash away the sweat from Felix's paws along with all the grime, but you also wanted to live through that.

After a great deal of running, it seemed the down pour would never end as you reached the edge of the paw-print, but really it wasn't. This was the end of a pad, its just that huge walls separated out the toes and claws, which appeared to be too far under the plant to be effected by dew. Examining the wall, you find a small hole, even to you it is tiny, but you can fit in and move forward, seeing light at the other side.

At the end you find that wasn't light but a very shiny piece of rock, however it is reflecting light from around a corner. Very quickly, you move on around, expecting the curve will take you to a toe. Its slower going this time and you have to move forward on your belly, it is that low and its a longer run too. After a while, you realize that this is also a climb upward, it seems steep and to be making a lot of distance, but on the grand scheme, a kid's finger-nails were longer than the whole foot print was deep.

Finally, you emerge to find yourself in the center pad again, but higher up, on a cliff that is almost as high up as the ground around the print. However there is a problem, its also too far from the edge, likely carved apart by a piece of fur or something. Either way, there was no way to reach the toe-print in which the paw-print was made. Jump and you'd never make it, climb down and over, you'd slide to the ground, it was unattainable.

Eventually, you sat at your high perch, legs stretched in front of you and for a second, laugh at calling this high. For one thing, a paperclip was bigger than this hole, as a little kid who was barefoot and loose on a playground you'd made deeper pits and taken bigger falls. You looked down at your body and saw a total mess, you were coated in dirt and in places it made you blacker than Felix's pads.

Suddenly, the thought train is forced to a stop as thunder fills the area like nothing else. Far off, you think you see the sliding glass door of the back of the house open, but aren't sure. Seconds later, an Earthquake that shattered the richter scale like an egg. This tiny, you'd yet to be around a full-sized person walking around and now you never wanted to again, someone could be hundreds of miles away and do this, up close would be even worse.
1223121111112112.title: Here comes something big
