12231211111121121.content:
The ground shakes and just keeps on rocking as the titan gets closer and closer. From here you can see the toes of a furry walking mountain, but that's all so far. Already you'd been on your counterpart this size, though never his feet so that would be bad as at a scale larger it was nearly impossible to survive, this probably would be impossible. Should that be Felix, it would be even worse as he knew where you were and could come for you, even if he couldn't see you.

Time seems to pass slow, even slower than in normal bad situations. Its like the enormous white walls in the distance are only closing at the slowest pace they can, though truthfully they are moving far faster than you ever could, with two feet exceeding 20 miles on your scale. Gradually though, he closes in and becomes more focused as your eyes handle the closer distance better than the greater one.

Suddenly, the creature is clearly Felix. His toes are around 3 miles tall and seem forever wide whenever they splay against the ground. Looking skyward, you fail to scale much more of him, its just too disturbing of a thought to bring to mind right now that he's suddenly so large. Whats worse though is he'd headed right for you and its fairly certain that he's going to destroy you rather than attempt some sort of rescue.

As he closes, you see his claws sticking clearly out of each toe, to the creature that made your current footprint they were sharp as needles. to you they came down to a broad plane probably as big as a soccer field or so. If the claws came down, they'd crush rather than cut, so at least now he couldn't inflict harm by making you bleed but rather he'd just make you a stain and end it there.

Once on you, his enormous foot, far larger than Tom's would level the toe-print from Tom and then Felix's on footprint from earlier. Being smaller than a spec of dust, you might survive but probably would not. The forces here are in billions of tons hitting on a 15 mile area, not counting the gaps between the toes, which were miles to you anyway.

At last he's on you, the pads are looming overhead, bigger than cities...
12231211111121121.title: It all gets worse

122312111111211211.content:
At one 625th or so of an inch tall, everything has enormous holes in it. A girl's manacure or pedacure is anything but smooth, rather more like canyons and valleys. This fact has kept dirt stuck to people for ages as it would get in a tight space and they couldn't dig it out. Its part of how barefeet get dirty and how contact can spread things, its also what saves you.

The enormous foot comes down like a lightning bolt as it covers miles in seconds. Air is shoved downward by the shear wall, it works like an ancient fan made from a huge plant leaf or one of those cheap folding paper fans. Tons of pressure stacks in the small space and it becomes impossible to stand or move as you fall to the ground, pinned without even being touched and at that, technically by one of the few things smaller than you.

All goes black as the foot blocks out t he sun. Your surrounded by cold liquid and float upward on pure reaction to what has just happened. Felix's sweaty paws have dumped a few drops on you, but its like an ocean of the stuff rather than the lake from earlier. At the top, you look around to see nothing, then suddenly feel pressure again but with something solid there, something harder than any rock ever was, or for that matter any metal.

Light floods back in, blinding you for several seconds. When you open them, you see the ground far, far below. Looking around, its soon discovered that your in what is comparatively a valley, a huge imperfection a couple hundred feet deep in the Lynx's pad. That is how you avoided being crushed, though it wasn't totally certain what kept you here. The only guess right now was that the Feline's mass was great enough to create its own gravity, or at least enough to effect you.

It was rather disturbing to see the ground and light coming and then going like this, but there was nothing that could be done about it right now. You just hoped that Felix didn't get into a fight or wrestle anyone or kick at anything, every one of those cases would have enough force to throw you off or push the pad in enough to reach you. Recalling some early memories, it was also known that no-tactic was ever spared in some fights, a few of which could end up killing you.
122312111111211211.title: dusty survival

1223121111112112111.content:
Felix was overjoyed at his new height, he no longer feared bugs but rather it was their turn to run or be crushed under foot. Little kids were just that again, little, light weight and fairly weak creatures, rather than miles tall creatures that would put atomic bombs to shame in terms of destructive ability and lifted billions of tons with the weakest muscles.

Outfront, he didn't watch where he was going and plowed right through a small group of kids before going down himself. His head was on better things right now, what'd he care if he rammed someone. If anything, the cat was happy to have rammed someone as it was more evidence of his new position and power in life.

Underfoot, all you noticed was suddenly being burried in oceans of mud, coming up and then getting exposed to the open air without being drug back down again. A second later, fighting broke out and the world became a blur to you as Felix struck out furousciously with his feet, luckily you are not thrown off. The tips of the titan toes reach out and slash with towering claws, to you its more force than nuclear weapons.

Felix is outnumber, but just happy to play and not do so under a canopy of grass or carpeting. His feet, fur and whole body are soaking wet with mud, but he doesn't care. This is a blast!

On the enormous pad, your at last jarred lose and fly into the air, the torrent of mud slamming around finally did it... You land..
1223121111112112111.title: Fighting in the Mud

1223121111112112112.content: You had absolutely no idea how it happened, but it did and you were thankful for it. Something happened that could help you turn the tide against the traitorous Felix.
1223121111112112112.title: A improbable event

12231211111121121121.content:
"Goodbye cuz" said Felix as he slowly raised his state-sized foot over you. Felix brought his foot down on you, but then stopped when you thought about him to stop. You were stunned as Felix hung his foot a centimeter ( to him ) over you. You then told him to get his foot from over you. Felix then instantly put his foot right next to his other an awaited your next command.


"Wow" you said to yourself "Felix is obeying my every command" You slowly walked up to Felix preparing yourself to run if this turned out to be some cruel joke. You nervously touch his miles tall toe, but Felix remained unresponsive as ever. " I guess Felix is now my slave" You mischievously think to yourself. You then command Felix to pick you up. Felix offers you a claw which you grab onto as he lifts you up an places you in his ear. You then think of how high your chances of survival with your mind control powers.
12231211111121121121.title: It's all in the mind

122312111111211212.content:
The foot loomed overhead, it was absolutely enormous. A few steps would level a city or it could just drag over it, the whole thing was taller than any city ever would be, so knocking one down would be easy. The end seemed to finally be here, if your obituary were ever written it would say "Shrunken to 1/625th of an inch tall and crushed by furry cousin's toes. Evidence licked off in bath that night."

Suddenly, that line changes. As the titan's toes come flying down, you see yet another portal. The universe was extremely unstable and well, the more portals got used, the more would open. When someone went through that made a ripple in the fabric of space and a few portals could open around them, especially in the presence of someone else who had their own ripples following. Your jumping through so many portals recently has made it possible to open one here as Felix's huge ripples made small holes against your microscopic ones.

Hovering in the air, you saw that shimmer indicating a portal. There was no time to think things through, you just ran forward and dove through it. On the other side, everything was dark as you blacked out, but wherever you were, it was bright, warm and sunny. Before you eyes closed, black and white objects filled your vision and in the distance, you thought there may well have been something pink.

Hours later, you come to. From the looks of the environment, you around an eighth of an inch tall, likely just under it. The environment consists of a smooth, fuzzy material underfoot, its black and stretches to a round and drop at one end, and a climb at the other. As it climbs, you see white beams that seem to be weaved, running up the enormous incline. All around, there is grass stretching well over your head and off in the grass right to the side you see a huge object that appears to be black and white as well, with several large masses coming off it. It suddenly clicked in, these were skating shoes, by the coloring it was extremely likely they were your brother's.

It could be dangerous to let him see you, but he could also help. You figure at the worst case, he's over a half-mile tall and won't even notice you. In the best-case, he's just over 2000 feet tall but manages to notice that your there and helps after laughing at your nudity and some pay-back.
122312111111211212.title: A bit bigger

122312111112.content: Your giant lynx version agreed to take care of you and Felix. You both had a tiny box in his closet to live in. The box was barely bigger than your lynx version's ( call him LV from now on ) little toe, but it was bigger than mansion to you and Felix. The three of you talked for a while until you heard a women's voice that sound like your mother's calling LV to dinner. LV asks do you want to come with him and eat off his plate or have him bring something back?
122312111112.title: Dinner

122312112.content:
At the moment, there was no information about the furry you. He came from another reality, could have lived a different life and been a whole other person. The odds of getting somewhere with him were against you, but destructive as Tom was, he could be the solution. Of the two, you knew your now big brother better.

The right foot is directly in your path, it was going to be the quickest way up, though immidiately you see problems in your route. Just to being there is only one viable way up, the toes. They're the part in your path and unfortunately, the only part touching ground as he's standing on them in an effort to better see the furry's rather to him, odd ears. Its given him at least a thousand feet in height. While he's like this, the kid's more likely to move around and that close you have no-way to avoid him.

Just as you begin forward again, determined to scale mount "lil' bro", you are halted again. The enormous foot of your counterpart is suddenly in the air directly over you and low enough to touch down on you. Five black pads fill your vision, soft to someone normal sized, you bet they'll crush you like a twig. Then as quickly as it was there, the massive mountain like floating structure is gone, to have landed at least a half-mile away.

That's how easy it is for a giant to kill you. One would never know it and all that would survive as evidence would be a red blood stain on their feet or whatever crushed you that would be 1/25th of an inch long if that and almost non-existent in depth. For the Lynx that'd be a pin-head sized dot on a surface of black that was continually exposed to rough dirts, rubbing the micro-stain clean if he didn't lick himself clean like a normal cat. In the case of your brother, in all likelyhood, mud would wash away whatever remained now matter where on him your were crushed.

Hastily, you push all those thoughts out of your mind; no more red stain on the threads in Tom's shorts, no more red-stain on a piece of fur or pad, none of that. Back on track, you move forward towards Tom once more, though the closer you get, the farther away you want to be. At 250ft away, toes dominate your view and the gaps between them forced wide by the weight on them, seem like valleys. The grooves that made finger and footprints are clearly visible and enormous, though not as deep as they should be, as they're filled with mud, it is only in some places that plain flesh is visible. Even the toe-nails are coated underneath where it seemed not even you could fit.

Out of nowhere, everything is a sudden blur. Tom's titan toes disappeared for just an instant as they shot into the air, trying to get him higher to examine the odd ears. He's gone thousands of feet in the air, at least it seems it from here. The next seconds come in slow-motion as you find out what it felt like for the many bugs you crushed under your feet, though now you were far, far smaller than any bug. You wonder if the titan Tom will even feel anything besides floor under his toes?
122312112.title: Destructive Little Boy

1223121121.content:
This world truly was unstable. As your brother's little toe was about to reduce you to a mix of red blood on brown dirt, you got very lucky. It seemed a lightning bolt struck from the sky, just like when you got here. A shimmer filled the air right ahead and you felt dizzy just being near it.

Forcing off the dizzyness, you leap through the gateway. It couldn't send you anywhere worse and it couldn't do anything worse. Your little brother's toe alone was bigger than a football stadium, you were 1/25th of an inch tall and about to be crushed by it, anywhere was better than here. Heck, maybe it'd make you bigger?
1223121121.title: Portals and great timing

12231211212.content:
Passage through the portal was not exactly healthy, it was only just now that you were coming around as it had blacked you out yet again. Standing up, it seems you are on an unending plain, there are patches where a shiny material is visible, though its a rough type of material as well, but most of the plain is coated in some mix of dirt and mud forming hills and valleys and more.

There is a sudden booming overhead, its deafening. You look to the sky and all you see behind you is an absolutely enormous tower running into a blue thing that kept going and seemed to meet with another blue tower and then one like this. There comes another booming, but it is definitely feminine, a 'little' girl's voice, probably shrill if someone were on her scale but to you its bass. A second later, a spire slams into the surface out of the sky, you look up and see it connect to an even larger mass and keep going out of sight.

"What the hell?" you say, imagining this to be some sick person's idea of a real-life twilight zone. Nothing was making sense, where the hell were you. There was no place on Earth like this, not yours and not that damned new world Earth either.

Suddenly, there is another object flying from the sky, it lands directly in front of you, but quite a distance away. It looks like your counter-part but he's grown, he's grown a LOT. The toes were well clear of a thousand feet tall, at least 1200 if not more, running up he was standing 24,800 feet tall not looking at the ears. As he closed though, you realized that wasn't your double, it was Felix! This...was....Tom's....TOE NAIL! 25 times Felix's height, it was half a million feet in any direction to get off the nail, assuming it was the big toe.

Hurredly, you look for the portal, maybe a chance to dive back through it?
12231211212.title: Way Worse

1223121122.content:
As the enormous monstrosity came down, he just missed you. Being so small, the gap in his toes was like a valley when he was standing flat, and it was practically a canyon if he stood on them as they were forced apart just a bit by his weight. Everything fell to darkness when he hit, a huge bang and shaking spread out like a bomb going off and then it was still as he tried to reach those ears, though without jumping.

Standing up, you looked around in near total darkness, the only light came from the openings between the toes on either side of you. All the dirt made it feel like you truly were underground, at least for a second, then you found all the sweat and other yuck here too. In all likely hood, the slime and mud had been here for days, weeks and maybe even months or longer, a scary thought.

The walls began to move, little bits as if the giant wanted to move again but was unsure of where. Wasting no-time, you flung your naked body against a wall, not even caring to worry about where you'd come out on-top as in it all you'd lost track of which toes you were between. Of course, it was climb or die given the slight movements, it didn't matter where you were, just that there was distance being made.

At twenty feet up, you felt secure enough to look around. You were on the right side between two toes but had no idea which ones, during the jump your brother could have moved or held still. Another glance and it was noticed that you were farther in, earlier the nails were right there, but now you were almost at the back where the rest of the foot started. Lastly, you noticed just what it was you were climbing. Here, everything was an unidentifiable slime likely far thicker than you were tall, at the least you knew your arms could not reach skin under it. The stuff seemed to be a mix of mud, sweat and dirts, little rocks were mixed in and farther off there were boulders which started around half your size and grew into giants. Your whole front was coated in the stuff, it was everywhere on you; between your toes in globs proportionally thicker than Tom, all over your heels and running up the back of your legs, your stomach, arms, hands and places you'd rather not think of it being.

1312.content:
You look at the giant female creature holding you, eyes wide in surprise. You were surprised enough to see a giant woman... But it's even more surprising to see a giant woman who is part animal. She looks like a relatively young human woman in terms of her body shape, featuring decently wide hips and a decently sized bust, and she is even wearing a simple blue dress with a purse slung over her shoulder. However, her body is covered in white fur and her head is that of a cat with glowing green eyes. A long tail, tipped with black fur, waves slowly behind her, and long black hair cascades down both sides of her face, flowing down onto her shoulders. Her hands, one of which is maintaining a tight grasp on your tiny body, have soft pads on their palms, making them like paws and making her fist surprisingly soft and comfortable to be in.

"What... Are you?" she suddenly asks, perplexed. "I've never seen anything like you before. You're as small as a mouseperson... But you don't have any fur, or ears... or a tail for that matter."

"Um... Well, I'm a human," you say. "I'm not from here, though. I don't know how I got here."

"Not from here, huh? Guess that explains why I've never seen anything like you..." The giant cat girl pauses, her eyes widening suddenly. "Wait... Does that mean you're an alien?"

You are about to shake your head, but after thinking a bit, you realize that you actually are an alien. Clearly, this is not Earth, and since you're from Earth, you are technically an alien here.

"I'm not from here," you repeat. "Maybe that does make me an alien, but I'm not sure. That's not really too important right now, though. Can you tell me where I am? And... Maybe help me get back home? I know that's asking a lot, but you seem nice, and I hope you could help."

That little compliment near the end makes the cat girl smile. You're thankful for that. She seems more willing to help you now.

"I'm not sure what I could do," she says, "But maybe I can think of something. For now, do you mind if I take you to my house?"

You tell her that's fine, and she smiles back at you. She tells you to hold still, and reaches down with the hand not holding you to open up her purse, and then she gently places you inside, telling you that she doesn't want anyone seeing you and potentially causing problems. With that, she closes the top, sealing you in darkness as she begins to walk.

After a while...
1312.title: Feline

choices: "I'm busy right now...how about some other time?"
13122.content:
Within the dark confines of the catgirl's purse, you suddenly feel yourself being rattled about as she begins her walk. Luckily for you though, there really didn't seem to be too much inside, let alone anything heavy that could pin you down. Seeing as how it was a challenge to keep a standing position within the carrying bag, you quickly make your way to the closest corner as a means to keep some sort of balance inside. As you sit patiently placing your trust within this humanoid feline, a sudden jostle manages to toss you front first as the bag begins to ease into a stop. Confused, you gaze upwards wondering just what was going on outside.

"Hey there!" a female voice, despite being a bit muffled, emerges for above. To your surprise, you quickly discover that this new voice must've been some sort of companion to your feline friend. "Didn't expect to see you around here." the other voice says in a giddy tone.

"Well, it's my normal route of course." The catgirl replies with a small chuckle.

While continuing to gaze upwards, you can't help but wonder just what type of animal her supposed friend could be. Seeing as how you were in some odd world inhabited by humanoid animals, the possibilities seemed to be enormous over species. As you begin to contemplate just what she could possibly see, your ears continue to overhear the two's conversation.

"Oh my gosh! it's been forever though!" The other voice says still exuberant as before. "We Totally have to do something. Oh! I know!" She beams happily. "How about we spend the day at your place?" she suggests.

The sudden suggestion manages to leave your blood cold. There was no telling just what the feline's friend would be like, let alone if she would actually see you as a supposed friend or not. Above, it seemed like the catgirl was just as shocked as you were.

"M-My house?" she stammers taken aback by the suggestion.

"Duh!" The other voice replies playfully. "Who else's house am I talking about?"

"I...I don't know." The Catgirl stammers, obviously uncertain about the idea. "W-well...how about we try hanging out some other time?" she insists with a small chuckle. "I mean, I'm pretty busy right now so-"

"Wha? some other time?" The other voice asks taken aback. "Oh come on! it's the weekend, what could you possibly have to do?"

"Well..." The feline murmurs under her breath.

Your hope would spark up as cars would drive by, but there was no way to stop any of them… One thing strange you did notice though, was that people where you are must really like animals… almost every car you have seen has had some sort of animal sitting on passenger seat… you thought you could recognize the animal each time, but there was always something weird about each one of them.

The sun was getting close to the horizon, and soon it would be night. In the distance, you notice a figure. You speak to yourself…. “Oh thank god…. Maybe this person will help me… I need to get back to normal… or something…” As the figure approaches, you try to see who it is, but the sun is right in your eyes. You begin to hear a voice; you notice it is coming from the direction you’re now jogging. You could definitely tell this person was…

Especially if your first choice is this thing.... It was too late now... you standing in the middle of the sidewalk, paralyzed with fear... You just stare at the giant as it hangs up its phone, only a football field away at this point. You watch it put the phone in the pocket of his pants. As you watched his hands err I guess hand paws... you didn't notice the face of the creature look right at you. Still feeling paralyzed from the waste down, you lock eyes with the creature.

It starts to speak "Well what do we have here?" The giant fox takes a step or two forward, as it does so, you feel mobile again, and begin to sprint off to the grass to your right.          Melody's face dropped, "Oh! You're right, I totally forgot! Keith... I guess the best thing to do is..."
1421122121121.title: You say "Hi"

14211221211211.content:
"A-are you sure that that's the best option?" You asked while trying to keep the nervousness out of your voice.

         Sensing your apprehension Melody turns to her friend, "Could you give us a second?"

         "Sure," Katie replied, "There's something I wanted to work on anyway." With that the puma quietly left the table to move to a counter on the other side of the room while Melody scooped you up into her paws and walked out of the room and into the entryway of the house. "I know you're not comfortable with this," She started.

          You look up at Melody with raised eyebrows, "That would be putting it mildly."

         The wolf nodded in return, "Noted, but despite what you may think or feel based on your first impressions of her, Katie really is a kind and very caring person... after you get through her playfulness and borderline obsession with her science..."

         "That last part... didn't help..."

         "Well forget the last part and focus on me then," The canine replied as she lifted you so that you were just above the tip of her nose, "You trust me, right?" You nod without hesitation. "So trust my judgement here and give Katie the benefit of the doubt, you might be surprised at what you find."

         She holds you with her gaze for a moment before you turn away from her, "I don't know... Trusting total strangers is something that I typically avoid when I can."

         A moment later you were prodded and turned around by a digit on the paw that held you. You inadvertently turned to face Melody thanks to her 'assistance' and find her regarding you with what can only be discribed as puppy dog eyes. Her brows arched and furrowed while her sapphire blue eyes radiated her plea. She had even moved you back so that you could see her lower lip poking out in a pout like frown. Overall, the result was the once titan like anthro that could crush you by flexing her fingers now resembled a stray puppy in a cardboard box, begging to be adopted. As if that weren't enough she the followed up with a soft spoken request, "Please? It'd mean a lot to me..."

         You snapped your eyes shut and turned away, "Alright! Fine! I'll give it a shot! Just- stop looking at me like that!"

         Almost instantaneously, Melodys face reverted back to her normal and cheery disposition, "Thanks Keith!"

         You stared at her dumbfounded as she drew you in and hugged you against the fur on her cheek, "I think she just played me..." you thought to yourself. After a brief hug and goodbye, Melody set you back on the table in the lab and darted out the door, but not before promising to come back for you in a few hours.
14211221211211.title: Trust and Manipulation

choices: She breaks into a wide grin
She gives you a small smile
142112212112111.content: You instinctively cringe as you feel an overwhelming presence lurking behind you. As you slowly turn around, you find yourself staring into the wall that is Katie's stomach. You crane your neck up to find her regarding you with a neutral expression. Mercifully, she bends down to your level, allowing you to lower your gaze and not strain so much.
142112212112111.title: Harbinger of what is to come

choices: Cross you're arms and refuse to play
1421122121121111.content:
"You seem tense..." Katie noted.

         "It might be the maniacle grin your giving me," You retorted.

         "Perhaps," Katie mused, "Though find it far more likely that you're nervous about being here with me in general."

         You gave her a hesitant nod, "I can't deny that."

         "So I propose a game to break the ice," she continued.

         "What game?" You asked as an uneasy lump formed in your throats while an unnatural fear rose in your gut.

         Katie leaned forward with a smile, "I was thinking cat and mouse."

         You involuntarily shuddered at that prospect, "Er, Katie... I'm not sure-"

         "-Please..." She interrupted, "Call me Kat."

         For a moment you mind jumped the tracks of logic, getting stuck on the rather cliche' nickname, "That sounds a bit..."

         "Cliche?" Kat asked, "Maybe it is," She added with a shrug, "But then again, I think it suits me given the game we're about to play and the fact that I am a feline." She then scooped you up into her paws without warning and brought you up to her face, "Don't you agree?" You could only nod under the gaze of her bright green eyes. She giggled before setting you down on the ground, "I'll give you eight minutes to hide."

         "What if I don't want to play?" You demanded, surprising yourself with your outburst.

         Kat's ears flicked as she stared down at you with a toothless smile, "That's entirely up to you. But you should know that I'm going to play regardless, and as fair warning, most mice usually end up inside the cat during this game."

         A wave a shock and horror rippled across your face, "You wouldn't actually-"

         "Oh my!" Kate interjected, "Already down to seven minutes and thirty two seconds!"

         "You already started!?" You shouted in surprise, "That's not even remotely fair!"

         Katie giggled a bit as she moved to a table leaving your pleas to land on her back, "Maybe not, but if life were fair you wouldn't be stuck in a world where you're the size of a mouse and surrounded by predators," The Puma reasoned. "By the way, your down to six minutes and twenty five seconds... time for little mice to get moving. Well, the smart ones at least," She laughed as she started fiddling with one of her projects.
1421122121121111.title: She breaks into a wide grin

choices: when you awake, Melody is at your side.
You're only out for about thirty minutes.
14211221211211111.content:
You feel very frightened, exhilarated even, but in a bad way. Your gut turns over, you don't want to play now. Maybe somewhere inside of you, just for a moment, you had felt a wanting to go with the flow, to follow along with her game and be a good acquaintance... but not if she's going to scare you into playing. You stand there and fold your arms.

"I'm not gonna play Katie!" You shout to her. (You shout because you're a bit far from her.) She continues to hum and mess around with her mechanisms and experiments. Her tail flickers from side to side in an innocent sway... she's still gonna play.

"Come on, Keith! You've five minutes left to hide." Kat meows. She giggles a bit. You grunt. It's like you're talking to a child. You stand on the desk, waiting patiently for her to turn around and say 'o.k., we don't have to play if you don't want to.'... but she doesn't. With every passing minute you feel like you both gain and lose confidence at the same time. Your instincts are telling you to hide so badly that you've broken into a nervous sweat.

"Katie...? Come on now." You call to her anxiously. Your words go through one puma ear and out the other. "You're making me nervous." You tell her flatly. You try to look around her to see what she's working on, but her massive frame blocks too much of the view. You glance left and right, still with your arms crossed. Your heart pounds by just standing. Another minute goes by...

"Thirty seconds, Keith." She says with a monotonous tone. This time her voice seems to have changed its demeanor. You freeze and contemplate hiding, but you know she can't hurt you without hurting her friend... right? You breathe in and out in an attempt to calm yourself. Maybe your assertiveness will pay off when she turns around to see you not playing. "Alright, times up." She says out loud. She turns around, her gaze now frighteningly scary. You stand still, you want to run, you absolutely want to run so much! She locks her eyes on you and steps closer. You progressively look up as she approaches. The puma towers over you, her petty stare peering right into your soul. The puma puts a paw out and grabs you. You're squeezed, but not too rightly. The feline brings you up to her face once more. She doesn't speak. You shiver, what is she thinking? Thoughts run through your head, ranging from 'I should have hid' and 'Where's Melody'.

"K- Kat- ie?" You stutter. Your voice breaks a bit, revealing your composure to be weakening. Suddenly she opens her mouth, you gasp. You grasp the strands of hair on her paws as she lifts your small body into the air. Skillfully she tosses you up, while in your apex she catches you by the leg. You dangle over her open mouth, her hot breath washing over you. "Katie?!" You yell terrified, you flail around trying to hit her nose until she suddenly drops you. Adrenaline courses through your body as you land on her tongue. It's wet and it feels sharp. Your eyes widen as she clamps down, shutting you out from the outside world. You're left in total darkness, her tongue forces you into the roof of her mouth. She pushes you around all inside of her mouth, completely coating you with her spit. Your shouts of protests are muffled from the outside world. She tastes you for a while. You could feel her purrs emanate from her throat.

You feel exhausted after a while from trying to fight it, your body giving up on you. "No..." You plead. You go limp. With one last suckle on your four inch mass, she puts a paw in her mouth and lightly grabs your torso. You lay half-awake on her paw, drenched in saliva. You groan. You can't exactly rub your eyes with nothing dry. You hear her say something like 'I wasn't gonna eatchya, silly!' ... then you faint.
14211221211211111.title: Not gonna play.

choices: She uses one of her experiments to release you. (Success)
14211221211211112.content:
You realize that maybe, from what Melody said, 'Kat' isn't really such a bad person- er... puma? Melody said after you get through her goofiness and craziness, she would be a good friend. (Or so to speak.)

"Six minutes!" Katie calls. She stops fiddling with her apparent project, she's across the room by now, her frame looking out a relative window. You scan around, there are not to many places to hide... especially when you're four inches tall on a table. At least this table is more than just a table, it connects to the other ones to make the appearance of a doctor's office... but it's full of science and miscellaneous things. For five minutes, you scramble to find a good place. You eventually decide to try and climb her cameras. Her room is filled with so many things, it seemed almost a perfect ladder to the top of the shelves above her tables. Seems almost too perfect...

"Thirty seconds!" Katie lists out her playfulness in a purr. She must be super excited to play with a new species. You reach the top of the head level cabinets and run towards the wall, crouching so she can't see you if she glanced up. You're well on top of a hiding place! The thought of what she said, 'most mice usually end up inside the cat'... it chills you... she can't mean it, right? How would Melody feel? "Alright, hope you found a spot!" She laughs. She turns around and clasps her paws together. You frown. She looks around the room for a bit trying to find where you are. You breathe lightly, for you don't know how much noise these large animals can pick up. You don't lay on your stomach, mostly because it's really dusty up here.

You hear the sounds of shuffling and the moving of mechanical objects, sometimes she'd exclaim 'Aha!', to only find she was wrong again. Katie mumbles to herself, trying to use her brain. Her face lights up. You can't see her; you don't take the risk of peeking over the top of the cabinets to watch her. "This may be unconventional, Keith... hehe." She chuckles, she turns around to look at the conveniently placed material you had climbed up on. "But Melody had taken a Psychology class a couple years ago. I, on the other hand, took a biology class." She rants. You make a puzzled expression accordingly. What is she talking about? "Oh, I don't know... but a little intuition and thinking put two and two together..." She was readily looking at the items, a smile growing wide on her face, her teeth showing with pride. "And you make a good trap for little intruders... like mice in a lab." She finishes. "I know where you are this time, Kieth!" She puts her paws on the top of the cabinet, your stomach drops. She pulls herself up and looks left to right, landing her gaze on you. "There! Ha!" She exclaims, her furry arm extends to grab you, but you're just out of her reach.

"Ah!" You gasp. You scramble and dart across the top of the cabinet. She stumbles and falls. You feel a massive thud, but she simply landed on her bottom, brushing it off. You breathe rapidly.

"Originally, I set those items there for actual mice, but I see you're the only one it-" She was pushing off the floor mid-sentence, "worked on!" She grunts and pulls herself up, this time, she's right in front of you. Your eyes meet hers, she throws a paw out to catch you in your running trajectory, you don't have enough time to react and land in her paw, she grasps. You're squeezed, and let out a cry of pain, she was crushing you. But that wasn't the worst part about it- she didn't adjust herself properly when she grabbed you, and she violently falls back to the floor, letting you go. You're lifted and you're flying through the air, your heart is pounding. You freeze, your spine sends a gut wrenching feeling through your whole body- you're falling! Kat lands on her back, she clenches her eyes shut as she hits the floor. "Grraawr!" She grunts. Kat opens her eyes and sees her little friend falling! Your eyes are wide open as you fall towards her face.

She gasps, reaching out to grab you... but you fall past her paw... and straight towards her face. She doesn't expect you to fall so quickly, your mass speeds towards her face, and her opened maw. You brace, expecting to land on her head, a heavy landing, but you don't? Immediately, your body feels a soft surface, everything goes dark. Katie chokes, putting both her paws to her throat. She's forced back a bit as you slam into the back of her mouth. You can't slow down, though, and your upper body is stuck in her throat. You're stopped. You feel the tough, jerkish gags coming from these soft insides. She keeps trying to push you out with her natural, overpowering strength, but she can't get you out. Every vibration and movement only slides you deeper into her throat. You're coated with saliva, slipping.

Your muffled yells don't help. Kat's eyes tear up from her attempts, she wasn't planning on this, she was just going to tease you by putting you in her mouth, but her over playfulness made her irresponsible. You feel gravity pull you down once more, her muscles are a traitor. She instinctively gulps. You feel a rush as her body clamps around your small form. It's dark, hot, wet, and you're sliding into her stomach. "Nono! No! Ahh!" You shout, mouth opening, you only get wetness in your mouth as a return.

"Oh no! Oh no no no!" Kat panics. She feels the bulge go down her neck, and with a paw she inspects it. She coughs and gets up. On the inside, you're shook around, you reach her stomach entrance. Her muscles squeeze you past, and you're pulled through into a small opening. The vibrations from her panicked voice are like an earthquake. You're scared out of your mind by now, hurt from her paws, and being constricted by the soft walls all around you. You wince in pain, she had to have broken something? On the other hand... you feel an odd arousal being in Kat's stomach...

Kat hurriedly looks around, trying to figure out how to get you out. (You get one freebie because that wasn't lucky.)
14211221211211112.title: Kat and her excessive playfulness!

choices: Reading with Katie is surprisingly relaxing
Reading with Katie is a road littered with booby traps
1421122121121112.content:
The large feline chuckled as she looked down at you. "I see she convinced you to stay," She observed, "I wonder if it had anything to do with a cute puppy dog face?" You slowly and quietly nodded, "Ha! I knew it. That's Melody for ya, she's as sweet as can be and can end a fight without firing a single shot! She's been doing it since the day we met."

         "H-how long ago was that?" You asked.

         Katie shrugged, "Oh about twenty years or so give or take." She then laid a paw face up on the table, "But enough about that, let's see about making you some clothes." She carried you over to a table where you noticed several undressed dolls, two sewing needles and a sewing machine that seemed to have stopped midway through working on a doll outfit.

         "What's all this?" You wondered.

         "Well, ever since you guys started showing up-"

         "-You guys?" You interrupted.

         The puma nodded, " You're not an isolated incident. There's been dozens of you little guys showing up all over the place in random areas. Unfortunately, I've not been in the right place at the right time to catch any of you."

         "And that's bad because...?"

         "-Because, if I catch a human I'll study, protect and play with it," Katie explained.

         "Play?" Ray demanded dubiously.

         Katie ignored the accusing question and continued her explanation, "If some random person catches one of you guys they might eat ya... or crush you? Who knows?" You cringed as she set you down on the counter. "Now, as I was saying; I've been repurposing these doll clothes to fit one of you guys in case I ever found myself in your company. So go ahead, try some on!"

         You looked through the flies hoping for a style that would suit you and trying on anything that fit you. Eventually you found a white t shirt and a pair of gray sweatpants that fit. You hoping for some denim jeans, but at this point you were happy to have clothes at all.

         "Hmm," Katie mused, "they seem a little big on you. Could it be the molecular distortion effect? Or perhaps the doll maker's fabric wasn't very high on quality as it was in production... did I remember the deminsions wrong?" At length Katie waved her hands and shook her head, "Meh, it doesn't matter, I'll make sure to adjust some more clothes that fit you better later. Right now, I've got a manual I need to read over, and you're coming with me." Just then, you noticed a blur of motion out of your left eye. You turned just in time to see Katie's tail lightly smack into you. You were thrown off the counter with a yelp of surprise, a shout of fear and a grunt from the impact of landing in Katie's waiting paw. She laughed at your various expressions as she brought you up to her muzzle and dumped you on her snout just ahead of her green eyes.

         You glared at them with anger and frustration, "Are you trying to kill me?!"

         "No," She snickered, "Just give you a heart attack." Something told you it would be a long day before Melody came back to get you.

         âWhatever, it was, it was fast. I couldnât track it fast enough to keep up with it,â The first voice continued.

         You decided that your time would be best spent hiding instead of eavesdropping. You continued to search for a place to hide when the two giants walk into the kitchen. âOh, perfect...â You quietly moaned to yourself. One was the fox from earlier. She was wearing blue denim jeans with what looked like converse sneakers, but the toes were completely open exposing her paws and the claws on the tips of her toes. She wore an unbuttoned gray plaid long sleeved shirt, and a white v neck t shirt underneath. She had brown hair the naturally fell to shoulder length and soft amber eyes that seemed to radiate their own glow. Her conversational partner appeared to be a border collie. She had blonde hair pulled back With a green bandanna. Her two ears poked out of her hair and had the classic âdog ear droop at their tips. Her eyes were deep blue and she wore blue jeans with a green t shirt that matched her bandanna. She wasnât wearing any shoes at all, so her paws were completely exposed and she seemed to be a little shorter than the fox.

         You began to wonder where in godâs name that youâd ended up. But you decided to stick to the task of finding youâre safe haven.

         âSo this thing you saw,â The collie mused, âHow big would you say it was?â

         âSeemed kinda agile?â

         âActually it was impressively agile for its size.â

         âDid it happen to be blue and red in color?â

         The fox paused, âI didnât really get a good look at it, but it seemed more like an orange than a red to me... wait... how did you know what color it was?â

         It was at that moment, you realized you were wearing blue denim jeans and a red t shirt. You slowed to a stop, and with every fiber of your being screaming for you to keep running, you turned around to find the border collie locking her blue eyes on you.

         âBecause I think Iâm looking right at it,â She told the fox, âAnd whatâs stranger still, Iâm pretty sure its looking right at me.â

         The vixen turned to face her friend and then traced her line of sight to you, âOh my god, thatâs it! Thatâs what I saw!â

         âIt Kinda looks... like a human...â The border collie mused.

         âBut, those arenât supposed to be real,â The fox replied

         âTell him that,â The shorter canine replied.

         You were frozen in place, your willpower was gone. You wanted to move, but your legs just wouldnât do it. The fox took a step toward you ever so slowly, you finally regained control of your body and took a step back.

         âErm... hey there, we donât want to hurt you,â The fox coaxed as she gave you the friendliest smile she could muster. However, given your size you realize that believing her and allowing them to come near you would be no different than resigning your fate to them. It didnât help that you had rather recently experienced heartbreak, and you came from a disfunctional family to say the least. So needless to say, trust wasnât something you gave out freely, and you werenât about to trust these giants with your life.          A shadow fell over you prompting you to glance up, you found the border collieâs hand just above you blotting out the lights above.

         Some small part of you was amazed that she was able to reach you so fast given that her starting point would have been from behind where the fox was standing.          You started running for the furniture in the living room as you heard the fox yelling at the collie. âBree!? What are you doing?â She demanded, âYouâre going to scare the poor thing to death!â

7.6.16- Hi everyone. First off thank you for your wonderful additions and support over the past few years. This part of my life has become a lost passion but it is exciting to see people still adding. I apologize I have not been able to maintain/update this interactive with fresh material and makes me that much more thankful for others out there are taking the time to add to this story. I promise I will add some material soon and all these additions in the past few months make me want to add even more.

Kind Regards,
-J





Rules:
-Keep in second person
-The main character, "you" needs to stay anonymous (if you give a name, just keep it constant thereafter)
-Keep size (of the characters) in check for whatever path you take, keep it constant
-No blood and really gory stuff please, unless it's a way to end a path
-Try and make additions a decent size, bigger is always better, but whatever you put will be fine.
-Story is 18+, so do what you want in it.
-[NEW] 2-3 paragraph minimum, unless creating a chapter to change paths.

For more in-depth rules, look at the bottom of this page.

Please add if you have the time! Good adds = GP!

[Update- 9/1/11]- Hey gang, sorry for my lack of attention to this interactive. I was expecting a nice easy summer. But instead I got hell everyday. There is something to always be done. Even with my later additions I see myself adding less. I think we can change that.

When time allows me, I will be going through, editing/lengthening adds so that this thing will shine like it used too. So bear with me.

And for those of you who added in my absence, THANKYOU. You are the reason why I don't just let this thing collect dust.




If you think your writing is subpar, add it anyway. Or send me a rough copy and I'll add it after slight revision (I will give credit to the real author unless I am told otherwise). So this interactive is about a guy (basically 17-18 or so), who gets transported to "a furry world". In this world, he can either change size or not.

I will gladly take ideas and request for the next chapters. If you see any serious grammar mistakes, please contact me.

Enjoy!

In Depth Rules



1. Everything is in second person meaning using "you" as the main character, this also means don't create a name for yourself. Ex. "You ran away as the beast chased after you."

2."You" are basically a kid still, about 16 or 17. You have a good build, but nothing special. The giant furries are around the same age, varying with whatever path you choose. But for the story sake, don't go into detail about yourself, keep it open for all if you know what I mean.

3. I decided that certain aspects of a furry story are hindered by size limits... SO I have taken a portion of them out, I will start a section for "normal size".
